level.heading: DIRECTED IN-SERVICE TRAINING (ยง 29-4114) In lieu of termination in situations where the ICF/IID is not in compliance withederal CoPs, but residents are not in immediate jeopardy, DHCF may require anCF/IID to implement Directed In-Service Training (DIST) for deficienciesetermined by the District to be correctable through education. Thislternative sanction shall require the staff and relevant contractors of theCF/IID to attend in-service trainings and demonstrate competency in thenowledge and skills presented during the trainings. DHCF, in consultation with DOH and DDS, shall develop the areas forCF/IID staff and contractor training by incorporating the findings from theontinuous Quality Improvement Plan. Facilities shall use training programs developed by well-establishedrganizations with prior experience and expertise in training, services forndividuals with intellectual disabilities, and the operation of ICF/IID to meetraining requirements described in this section. All programs and personnel usedo deliver the training shall be approved by DHCF prior to their use. The ICF/IID shall bear the expense of the DIST. A state monitor shall oversee implementation of DIST, and shallnsure compliance with the requirements. DHCF may terminate the provider agreement of an ICF/IID that isnable to meet the timeline for full and successful completion of the DIST.
